page.title: 05Population and Housing
page.content: The population of Thurleigh is approximately 615 people. It is a very well balanced population, with 131 schoolchildren and 93 people of pensionable age.The oldest occupants of the area are a lady of 95 and a gentleman of 92, who still works and drives his car around the village. The population is made up of 221 households. There are houses of all descriptions in the village, to rent, to buy and tied accommodation. A lot of the council houses, in recent years been bought by their occupants. The type of dwelling varies from Victorian farmhouses, thatched cottages,old persons dwellings, modern houses and even a block of flats. The worry that the village has regarding the future, however is that housing is too costly for the young local people to buy.
